basics.name: Mai Nguyen, MS
basics.title: Economist and Data Scientist
basics.summary: Master’s degree in Business Analytics and Economics with 3+ years of experience in business intelligence, product growth, and marketing strategy across industries including e-commerce, consumer goods, technology, and education. Skilled in building dashboards, ETL pipelines, and applying advanced analytics to solve real-world problems.

work.name: University of San Francisco - Prospect Development & Analytics
work.summary: Supporting prospect development and analytics by building dashboards, models, and statistical analyses for marketing and fundraising optimization.
highlights: Built Tableau dashboards from Salesforce and public datasets, enabling stakeholders to monitor marketing KPIs, conversion funnels, and campaign performance to increase goal attainment by 50% by 2030.
Developed sentiment analysis models for prospect notes and integrated them into a propensity scoring system, improving lead conversion by 20%.
Applied Difference-in-Differences analysis to quantify ~$9K uplift in donations from Fundraising Day, shaping alumni engagement strategy.
Created User Acceptance Testing plans for data migration validation, reducing pipeline errors and ensuring reliability.

work.name: Educational Results Partnership
work.summary: Worked on education-focused data infrastructure and analytics to improve outcomes for millions of students across California.
highlights: Led development of the Black young adults’ educational outcomes project in collaboration with government agencies, defining data collection methods and metrics.
Designed a new SQL Server database schema and two automated ETL pipelines, reducing processing time by 80% and improving data integrity by 60%.
Engineered automated SQL procedures to compute 100+ metrics on ~30M+ end-users, delivering real-time insights for policymakers and colleges.

work.name: Fortune 500 Consumer Goods Company
work.summary: Supported global e-commerce analytics and marketing optimization projects.
highlights: Collaborated with Data Science team in China to analyze traffic cannibalization on JD.com (600M+ AAU).
Built boosted tree models predicting traffic cannibalization with 90% accuracy, improving channel budget allocation.
Developed an interactive R-Shiny dashboard for non-technical teams to run predictions, reducing budget inefficiency by 10%.
Awarded Best Paper at the Midwest Decision Science Institute Conference and presented poster at INFORMS Business Analytics Conference.

volunteer.summary: Led the mainstage operations team for a premier technology summit, coordinating logistics, speakers, and cross-functional teams.
highlights: Oversaw on-stage scheduling and speaker coordination for a 500+ attendee summit.
Directed volunteers and collaborated with event sponsors to ensure smooth execution.
